parameters.zn: proportion of residential land zoned for lots over 25,000 sq.ft.
parameters.crim: per capita crime rate by town.
parameters.age: proportion of owner-occupied units built prior to 1940.
parameters.indus: proportion of non-retail business acres per town.
parameters.rm: average number of rooms per dwelling.
parameters.medv: median value of owner-occupied homes in $1000s.
parameters.black:
1000(Bk - 0.63)^2 where Bk is the proportion of blacks
by town.
parameters.dis: weighted mean of distances to five Boston employment centres.
parameters.chas: Charles River dummy variable (= 1 if tract bounds river; 0 otherwise).
parameters.rad: index of accessibility to radial highways.

description:
Description
The Boston data frame has 506 rows and 14 columns.
title: Housing Values in Suburbs of Boston
reference:
Harrison, D. and Rubinfeld, D.L. (1978)
Hedonic prices and the demand for clean air.
J. Environ. Economics and Management
5, 81–102.
